subject: Management
title: High-Trust Organizations
description: Learn High-Trust Organizations in one minute.

hook.text: A factory let workers set their own hours. Productivity jumped 40%. Management was stunned.

buildup.text: High-trust cultures spend less on monitoring, auditing, and controlling people.

discovery.text: Paul Zak's research: high-trust organizations have 74% less stress and 50% higher productivity.

twist.text: Trust is efficient. Every approval layer, every surveillance tool, every sign-off is a tax on speed.

climax.text: Give trust first. Remove unnecessary approvals. Measure outcomes, not activity.

punchline.text: Control is expensive. Trust is a competitive advantage.

quiz.question: How do high-trust organizations outperform low-trust ones?
options: They have less stress, higher productivity, and spend less on oversight
They have stricter rules that employees naturally want to follow
Trust has no measurable impact on organizational performance
